sub_title: Supply Chain Planner & Coordinator for packing materials
summary:
Collaborate with colleagues in an international environment; working with different nationalities is what suits me. The challenge for me (both internal and external) is to cope with different manners and switch between the different customer relationships in the European countries. 
To my clients, I am service oriented, commercially driven, with the aim to maintain and further develop my customer relationship. My activities are coupled with precision and a structured approach. Competencies that fit my personality are: collegial, eager to learn, team-player with a healthy dose of humor

school.name: Loi University of Applied Sciences, Leiden

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for the packaging materials and load carriers for suppliers and customers in the Novo Nordisk supply chain.
- Ensuring that the planning of load carriers can cover the future demand and perform bi-annual budgeting for purchase of more load carriers.
- Close collaboration with many different stakeholders at many different levels within Novo Nordisk (i.e., production sites, the central SCM organization, planning, purchasing, quality, etc.). 
- Working with projects that are focused on driving optimization within the department.
- Improving processes for packaging materials and move the world of the packaging materials into the future, in both a digital way and in a sustainable way. Supporting the circular for zero ambition. 
- Document all changes (Change Control) made throughout the projects. This includes describing new processes and ensuring that they are following external requirements.
- Dialog with the Novo Nordisk production sites worldwide and demand related issues.
- Placing orders and follow up on delivery including reporting and KPI’s.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Managing relationship with (Commercial) Organizations, Business groups, manufacturing teams and suppliers from an end-to-end supply chain perspective.
•	Owning the Supply Planning process for the Business Unit to include development of overall market supply plans.
•	Maintaining accurate master data to enable a correct rule based supply plan.
•	Support phase in / phase out process execution from a planning perspective (PDLM) with the aim to phase in new products in-time and phase-out products without obsolete finished products and components
•	Planning, controlling and maintaining the master shipment schedule (MSS), balancing the customer demands, revenue forecast and inventory levels.
•	Developing supply allocation proposals when order book exceeds capacity/available production slots or material availability.
•	Pro actively being responsible for the supply chain through scenario mapping and root cause analysis. Look and think ahead and build allocations in case of constraints.
•	Supporting monthly S&OP supply review with the definition, and review of the supply plan to meet AOP and 12 month rolling integral inventory targets.
•	Collaborating with manufacturing site / OEMS suppliers to achieve the medium & long term planning inputs for S&OP review
•	Initiating and participating in BIU and supply chain improvement processes
•	Defining opportunities for improvement driven by operational excellence, customer happiness and cost reduction.
profile_positions.title: Supply chain planning administrator

profile_positions.description:
• Organizes guides and controls the physical distribution services with limited number of suppliers and services with a moderate complexity, in order to support the business operation through the provision of optimum Physical Distribution-services. 
• Defines and implements the Physical Distribution-service level agreements (SLA’s & KPI's), monitors these for non-compliance and takes corrective actions. 
• Controls, manages, reports and improves existing SLA’s of a moderate complexity. Improves existing SLA’s and driver’s and develops new less complex SLA’s. 
• Responsible for 3th party supplier management together with his/her peers in the team 
• Drive CAPA (Corrective Action Preventive Action) improvements project with service provider 
• Lead operational meetings with markets, orderdesk and service providers and decide on operational process attention point 
• Maintain, validate and develop
profile_positions.title: Physical Distribution Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
The linking pin between the different stakeholders, Philips Digital & Computational Pathology sales organization, the Philips support organization, the DCP Installation and Supply Chain teams.
Responsible for supporting sales with creating quotes in Sofon and follow up on quote approvals. 
Supporting sales with sales orders, initiate order intake + customer credit checks. Ensure orders are timely and correctly processed towards the Supply Chain.  
Collaboration with the different Philips Key Markets. 
Support customers on their new orders, communicate status and correct timelines.
Participate in the cross functional status meetings for running projects, supporting the establishment and execution of each projects key initiatives. 
Participating in improvement projects to evaluate existing processes and come up with improvement suggestions.
profile_positions.title: Sales Support Manager Philips Pathology

profile_positions.description: Primary contact of the key markets to place orders on the factory for imaging equipment. Develop and maintain positive customer relations; coordinate with various functions within the Center of Supply chain Excellence (CSE)/Center of Manufacturing Excellence (CME) to ensure customer requests are handled appropriately and in a timely manner. Responsible to substantially affect the relationship between the company and our internal and external customers.
profile_positions.title: CT/AMI Order Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for management of sales orders, overseeing and coordinating of the entire order delivery    process for the regions Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) and Central East Europe (CEE) .
- Collaborate with the supply chain management planning and shipping departments.  
- Close contact with the F&A department regarding L/C’s and credit holds that are blocking shipments or PO’s. 
- Contact with logistic teams, factories, key Markets and customers/distributors.
- Make sure all orders are delivered to the customer, complete and on-time.
- Sending out confirmations of orders and other communications to customers. 
- Supporting the return order process, contact with the factories/customer for authorization confirmation for missing items or defect on arrivals.
  
Other administrative tasks: 
- Responsible for executing all order progressing in SAP and other supporting applications. 
- Order screening, clean orders.	
- Archiving Sales Documents files related to customers and countries according to local legislation. 
- Managing the order & requisitions, ensuring Internal Control Standards, SOX and export control compliance.

- Contribute in several projects which improve efficiency and the productivity for the organization or for the customer. (Lean/Kaizen)
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Order Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Coordinator between engineers and the customer with FEI systems.
- Daily order processing, support to the Nordic regions on order processing and configuration issues.
- Acting as the first point of contact of contact for all intercompany demands, issues and problems relating to system sales orders in a broad concept. 
- Organizing confirming dates for engineers planning. 
- Sending out confirmations of orders & planning to customers. 
- Maintain KPI’s to monitor the process for RMA’s/Calls & response times.

Contact with customers regarding:
- Yearly service of the systems.
- Dis-functioning of the systems and parts orders.
- Problem solving with shipping and order fulfillment issues.
- Sending out Quotes & processing orders.
- Orders, delivery time regarding parts.
- All aspects of RMA, processing & invoicing. 

Other administrative tasks: 
- Schedule engineers and confirm appointments with the customers.
- Responsible for the agenda’s for 9 engineers 
- Secure revenue bookings trough Mfg/QAD & .NET	
- Identify show stoppers.
- Back-up for Order Desk Sr. and assisting in problem solving when needed.
- Contribute in several logistics projects which improve efficiency and the productivity of the Order desk group, the logistics team or the overall operations targets.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Perform order management processes in Oracle
- Support the International account managers through order management

Point of contact for clients in Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Eastern Europe on:
- Order Status
- Delivery times
- Complaints handling

Returns:
- For Norway, responsible for the proper export documents and customs papers.
- Participate in project teams in process improvement (Kaizen)
- Attend and assist international fairs in the Nordics
profile_positions.title: Customer & Order Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Bookkeeping of the local stores (financial + stock)
- Bookkeeping of the banks, both euro and U.S. dollar
- Coding of invoices
- Accounts Payable (cost side)
- Tracking and maintaining internal accounts
profile_positions.title: Financial controller
